title: Provide (or rather don't take them down) virtual machines for all previous versions of Windows 10
body: This is not really completely UWP related, but Microsoft should provide free virtual machines of all Windows 10 versions for testing purposes, as in my experience UWP is really fragile and could make my app behave differently in every version.

comments.body:
Businesses take a lot longer to upgrade ranging, this is depsite their size from small to big, some are still willing to wait despite the original version no longer receiving updates. That means while you are trying to keep up with the great UWP features you have to keep several VM's around.
It would be great if there was a service like Xamarin Testcloud for UWP devices from mobile to desktop which is a serious lacking thing for UWP and will help with older version targeting.

This is no different than Windows 7 or 8 however.  MSDN subscribers do have access but if you want an evaluation copy, you can only download the latest version of Windows 10.  The VMs we provide here were designed for development use in mind.
No I don't, but since UWP allows to set both the MinVersion and TargetVersion for your app to run on a whole range of versions, it would be nice to have official testing environments for all of them.
